Class Histogram

java.lang.Object
Histogram
public class Histogram extends Object
Calculate the Probability of Wind Speeds Using the Principle of Maximum Entropy and Linear Regression to create a Cumulative Probability Distribution Function that can be used to calculate the Probability of Wind Speeds.
Since:
April 30th

  • Constructor Details

    • Histogram

      public Histogram(double userDefinedInterval)
      This is the constructor of the class. Initialize the bins in the histogram with the interval spacing after obtaining the value for userDefinedInterval from the user
      Parameters:
      userDefinedInterval - This is the paramter to History constructor

  • Method Details

    • getData

      public void getData(Scanner s) throws IOException
      This method is used to get the file name and read the data in from the file and store them in an array called windValues
      Parameters:
      s - This is the paramter to getData method
      Throws:
      IOException - On input error
      See Also:
      • IOException

    • addHistogram

      public void addHistogram()
      This method is used to add each wind value to a correct bin. wind values stored in double[] windValues are squared and added to its histogram bin.

    • normalize

      public void normalize()
      This method is used to normalize the counts within the bins to cumulative probabilities.

    • cdf

      public void cdf()
      This method is used to compute the cumulative probability distribution function (K).

    • writeFile

      public void writeFile() throws IOException
      This method is used to save K, interval, and the cumulative probability your program computed for each bin to a file called "cumProbability.txt".
      Throws:
      IOException - On output error
      See Also:
      • IOException

    • analysis

      public void analysis(Scanner scan)
      This method is used to estimate the probability of wind speeds.
      Parameters:
      scan - This is the paramter to analysis method

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws IOException
      This is the main method. First, it asks for user's input of interval and name of the file they want to analyze. Then it normalize the data, compute K and write them to a file called cumProbability.txt. Finally, it runs the program to estimate the probability of wind speeds that the user enters.
      Parameters:
      args - Unused.
      Throws:
      IOException - On input error.
      See Also:
      • IOException
